sentences.en: And that's precisely what has him worried : real stardom.
sentences.cn: 这恰恰正是他所烦心的 —— 真正的明星身份.

sentences.en: He is being groomed ( ie prepared and trained ) for stardom.
sentences.cn: 他正在接受培植,以求他日成为明星.

sentences.en: He knew he was unlikely to get a shot stardom.
sentences.cn: 他明白自己不可能会突然蹿红.

sentences.en: His stardom looked to be all over.
sentences.cn: 他的星运看似到此结束.

sentences.en: In 1929 she shot to stardom on Broadway in a Noel Coward play.
sentences.cn: 1929年，她因出演诺埃尔·科沃德的一部剧而在百老汇一炮走红。

sentences.en: Jenny aspired to be a stardom when she was a little girl.
sentences.cn: 珍妮还是小女孩的时候就立志要做明星.

sentences.en: Mr Carruthers was never marked out stardom.
sentences.cn: 卡拉瑟斯绝不是注定要当明星的.

sentences.en: She danced her way to stardom.
She is on the escalator to stardom.
sentences.cn: 她青云直上地跻身于明星界.

sentences.en: She quickly graduated to the stage, then to stardom.
sentences.cn: 她很快就登上舞台, 然后成为明星.

sentences.en: She shot to stardom on Broadway in a Noel Coward play.
sentences.cn: 她因在百老汇出演了一部诺埃尔·科沃德的戏一炮而红。

sentences.en: The actor coasted to stardom on his good looks.
sentences.cn: 这位男演员靠自己长得漂亮而毫不费力地成了明星.

sentences.en: The dazzle of stardom and status attracts them.
sentences.cn: 明星的光彩和地位吸引着他们。

sentences.en: The record started the young singer on the road to stardom.
sentences.cn: 这张唱片使那位青年歌手开始挤身明星之列.

words.tran_cn: 担任主角的；用星装饰的；用星号标明的；受命运支配的
布满星星的；闪闪发光的；星光照耀的；星形的
扮演主角，领衔主演；纯锑表面呈星状花纹
使担任主角（star的过去式）；用星（形物）装饰
用星号标于；由…主演，由…担任主角

trans.tran_cn: 演员们，明星界，明星地位，群星
trans.tran_en: Stardom is the state of being very famous, usually as an actor, musician, or athlete
